item.title: Carol add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Carol add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can either practice being right or practice being kind." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Carol add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Carol add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Carol add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The soul is healed by being with children." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Carol add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "To find the balance you want, this is what you must become. You must keep your feet grounded so firmly on the earth that it's like you have 4 legs instead of 2. That way, you can stay in the world. But you must stop looking at the world through your head. You must look through your heart, instead. That way, you will know God." -- Elizabeth Gilbert
